meanings.definition: To divest or withdraw investment from something.
meanings.sent1: The company disinvests from risky ventures to protect its finances.
meanings.sent2: Investors disinvest when they believe the market is unstable.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel disinvests its acorn stash when it finds a better hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: She disinvests her time in negative thoughts, draining her energy.
meanings.sent5: The farmer disinvests water from the field, causing the crops to wither.

meanings.definition: To sell off or reduce investments in a particular asset or company.
meanings.sent1: The billionaire disinvests his shares in the tech company to diversify his portfolio.
meanings.sent2: During a recession, many people disinvest in luxury goods.
meanings.sent3: The magician disinvests his old tricks for new, more exciting ones.
meanings.sent4: She disinvests her emotional attachment to the antique vase, deciding to sell it.
meanings.sent5: The athlete disinvests his energy in the first half of the game, leading to exhaustion later.
